title: Frederick Forsyth - The Afghan (audiobook)
description:
The Afghan
Unabridged
By Frederick Forsyth
Narrated by Steven Crossley


When British and US intelligence catch wind of a major Al Qaeda operation, they&#039;re ready for action. But what can they do? They know nothing about the attack, so they plant The Afghan, a prisoner of Guantanamo Bay and a former commander of the Taliban.

Listening to THE AFGHAN is like watching a train wreck. You know it will be grotesque, that there will be bloodied bodies and hideous dismemberments, yet you can&#039;t help yourself. Frederick Forsyth has the ability to mesmerize with an insider&#039;s knowledge, and Steven Crossley&#039;s reading is no less insistent. British and American intelligence learn that Al-Qaeda is planning something big. Will it be nuclear? Biological? No one is sure. Someone has to infiltrate, a nearly impossible task. Nearly. British intelligence officer Mike Martin is the man for the job. Crossley&#039;s performance as an assortment of Brits, Americans, Arabs, Afghans, and Indians is flawless, and Forsyth&#039;s story of imminent disaster is irresistible.
